radiographic_examinations.findings: Liver is normal in echotexture without focal lesion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The pancreas is normal, though the distal tail is not well seen due to overlying bowel gas. Portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. Common bile duct is normal measuring 3 mm. The gallbladder is not distended, without mural edema or pericholecystic fluid. Multiple gallstones are seen, which are mobile. Minimal fullness is seen in the renal pelvis on the right.
